intro: Hydrobryum bifoliatum, commonly known as the two-leaf marsh plant, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its simple, grass-like leaves that are usually arranged in two rows along the stem. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments such as wetlands and forest floors. Its reproductive structures are typically small and inconspicuous, with spores produced in capsules. Hydrobryum bifoliatum is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to survive in nutrient-poor soils.
